法規內容.條文內容: This set of Regulations is formulated in accordance with regulations of Paragraph 4, Article 30 of the Communicable Disease Control Act.

Victims of immunization shall request for relief in accordance with the requirements and procedures set forth in this set of Regulations.
The scope of immunization as referred to in the preceding Paragraph includes the inoculation of vaccines that have been issued permit licenses or permitted for importation under a special project by the central competent authority and have been qualified and batch-sealed by testing or by review of documents.

There shall be on the subcommittee 19 to 25 members, to be invited on part-time basis by the central competent authority from experts in the fields of medical and health, anatomy and pathology, law, or impartial members of the community; one of them shall be appointed chairperson.
The total number of experts in law and impartial members of the community shall not be less than one-third.
The term of office of the members shall be for two years, and may be re-invited after termination of the term. When there are vacancies during the term, persons of the same categories of the original members shall be invited to fill the vacancies; their term of office shall be till the end of the original term of office.
Chairperson of the subcommittee shall be responsible for calling meetings and preside on meetings. In case the chairperson cannot be present for reasons, a president of the meeting shall be recommended from the members.

When the review subcommittee reviews cases for relief to hazards of immunization, they may appoint members or entrust organizations concerned and academic institutions to conduct investigation and study in advance; when necessary, they may invite organizations concerned or scholars and experts to participate in the assessment or be present for counseling.

There shall be two executive officers on the Subcommittee. They shall, by order of the Chairperson, assist in the review of matters concerning relief for immunization hazards. They shall be appointed on part-time basis from the existing staff of the subordinate Centers for Disease Control of the central competent authority.

To meet the needs for the review operations on relief, the subordinate Centers for Disease Control of the central competent authority may employ one to two professional or technical workers in the related fields.

Cases of compensation for vaccine injury, if with one of conditions in the following subparagraph, shall be subsidized at discretion:
1. Though the severe adverse reactions suspected of results of immunization are considered not associated with immunization after review, the medical costs incurred for reasonable examination and medical care performed for the purpose to clarify the association between the symptoms and immunization, a maximum of NT$ 200,000 may be paid.
2. Deaths suspected of being due to hazards of immunization and having been performed pathological autopsy shall be paid NT$ 300,000 as funeral subsidies.
3. Pregnant women resulting in stillbirth or abortion suspected of being due to hazards of immunization, after autopsy or examination of fetus or embryo, if the gestation is 20 weeks and above, NT$ 100,000 shall be paid; if the gestation is less than 20 weeks, NT$ 50,000 shall be paid.

Persons having the rights to request for relief to hazards of immunization as referred to in the preceding Article shall be:
1. For Subparagraph 1, Paragraph 1 of Article 7, legal heir of the victim;
2. For Subparagraph 2 through Subparagraph 4 of Paragraph 1 of Article 7, the victim.
Payments for death shall be made in accordance with relevant regulations of the Civil Law.

Persons having the right to request shall, when requesting for relief payments for immunization hazards, fill in an application form for the relief of immunization hazards (hereafter referred to as the application form), and submit together with certificate of hazards or other information sufficient to prove hazards for request to the local competent authority where immunization took place.

The immunization competent authority shall, upon acceptance of the request as referred to in the preceding Article, investigate within seven days the facts of immunization hazards, record within thirty days the results of investigation on the immunization hazards investigation report, and submit the application form, applicant’s medical records together with relevant evidence to the central competent authority for review.

The central competent authority shall, upon receipt of the entire set of information, refer the case to the Subcommittee for review in six months. When necessary, extension can be made once, for a maximum of three months.

The central competent authority shall, after reporting the review results of the Subcommittee to the person in charge of the organization for approval, notify in writing the person having the right to request, with copy to the immunization competent authority.

Relief payments shall be made by one appropriation to the person(s) with authority for application by the central competent authority in accordance with the results of the review mentioned in the preceding Article. However, this rule shall not apply if the results of the review are such that payments shall be made in several times pending upon the degree of hazards of the victims or their treatment.
Appropriation procedures of the relief payments shall be completed within three months upon delivery of the administrative action of relief payments.

With the exception of Articles 4, 4-1, 7 and 8 amended and announced on February 12, 2010, which become effective on November 1, 2009, and Article 2-1 amended and announced on December 14, 2012, which become effective on January 1, 2013, this set of Regulations shall be implemented on the day of announcement.
